thread.title: Quadrant Future Tek IPO Garners Nearly 200 Times Subscription; Listing On 14 Jan - BW BusinessWorld
thread.title_full: Quadrant Future Tek IPO Garners Nearly 200 Times Subscription; Listing On 14 Jan - BW BusinessWorld

title: Quadrant Future Tek IPO Garners Nearly 200 Times Subscription; Listing On 14 Jan - BW BusinessWorld
text:
The initial public offering (IPO) of Quadrant Future Tek closed for public subscription on 09 January 2024 after alluring enormous public subscription, while the grey market price (GMP) indicated listing above 65 per cent.
The Rs 290 crore IPO consisted exclusively of a fresh issue component with the price band fixed at Rs 275 to 290 per equity share.
The issue opened on 07 January and closed on 09 January followed by allotment on 10 January. Subsequently, the IPO will be listed on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) and Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) on 14 January.
Sundae Capital Advisors is the book running lead manager of the issue, while Link Intime India is the registrar for the offer.
Subscription
In its three day subscription window, the IPO received total bids of 195.96 times worth more than Rs 31,000 crore. Retail category filled whoppingly 256.46 times worth Rs 7,437.27 crore, while qualified institutions bid the issue 139.77 times, pouring Rs 12,160 crore.
Expert Note
“Quadrant Future Tek is a research-focused company developing advanced train control and signalling systems for the Indian Railways under the KAVACH project. In the interim budget of FY 2024-25, the Finance Ministry allocated Rs 2.55 lakh crore to Indian Railways, a 5.8 per cent increase. A strategic MoU with Railtel Corporation and a Rs 978.6 crore order from Chittaranjan Locomotive Works strengthen the company’s position as a leading original equipment manufacturer (OEM). The issue is valued at a price-to-earnings (PE) ratio of 59.1 times on the upper price band based on FY24 earnings, which is deemed fair compared to its peers,” said Abhishek Pandya, Research Analyst, StoxBox.
IPO Objectives
The firm proposed to utilise the net proceeds of Rs 290 crore funding of working capital requirement and capital expenditure of the company for the development of electronic interlocking system.
The net proceeds will also be allocated towards the general corporate purpose and repayment of debt availed by the company.
Additionally, the firm will also get benefits on listing in the public market which will enhance the brand’s visibility and provide liquidity to the shareholders.
Firm’s Financials
Quadrant Future Tek registered a revenue of Rs 151.82 crore in financial year (FY) 2023-24 against Rs 152.95 crore in FY 2022-23.
The profit after tax (PAT) increased to Rs 14.71 crore in FY 2023-24 against Rs 13.9 crore in FY 2022-23.
Quadrant Future Tek revenue decreased by 1 per cent and profit after tax (PAT) rose by 6 per cent between FY 2023-24.
The revenue and PAT of the firm in the first two quarters of FY 2024-25 stood at R 65.14 crore and a loss of 12.11 crore respectively.
